intro: Heteropterys sessilifolia, commonly known as the sessile-leaf heteropterys, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its simple, sessile leaves that are often clustered at the base of the stems. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. The species is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
